newsitem.title: JAPAN: LDP plans to privatise electricity wholesaler.
newsitem.headline: LDP plans to privatise electricity wholesaler.

text.p: Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) has decided to privatise the Electric Power Development Co Ltd, a power wholesaler, within the next five years, a party official said on Friday.
The move is aimed at promoting competition within the electricity industry, the official said.
Currently, the government owns two thirds of Electric Power Development Co, while the remaining one third stake is divided among nine electricity utilities.
The LDP plans to list Electric Power Development Co's shares in fiscal 2001/02 starting April 1, the official said.
Japan's electricity utilities have recently come under pressure from the government and the market to bring electricity rates down to international levels.

Before industry deregulation in December 1995, only special semi-governmental entities such as the Electric Power Development Co and the Japan Atomic Power Co would sell electricity on a wholesale basis to utilities.
Utilities can now buy power from independent power producers.
